page.title: 19Laverstock - Cockey Down.
page.content: The Hill between Laverstock and Cockey Down is known locally as{'Panda Hill'. Cut deep into the chalk side is the outline of the face of a Panda. This quite mysteriously appeared one night during the early '70s. The owner of the land, living at Coombe Bissett, was not aware of its presence at all for a while. Over the years, it{has {become a popular,albeit illegal, local {landmark.}There have been several attempts to keep it restored by local groups, but so far these have been firmly resisted. Most recently the local Parish Council are attempting to persuade the owner to relent to allow proper restoration. It was that on one night during the autumn of 1972, some eager, over zealous students from the University of North Wales, Bangor, had carved a 7-10metre representation of the Student Union emblem, in the turf.
